greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of achiral polyominoes with n cells.
comment: Polyominoes with n cells and at least one line of reflection symmetry. - _Joshua Zucker_, Mar 08 2008
link: Robert A. Russell, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..45
D. H. Redelmeier, Counting polyominoes: yet another attack, Discrete Math., 36 (1981), 191-203.
example: For a(4)=3, the achiral tetrominoes are a 2 X 2 square, a 1 X 4 rectangle, and a cell plus three cells adjacent to it (forming a shortened T).
results.author: _David W. Wilson_
ext: Name edited by _Robert A. Russell_, Feb 03 2019
